text: The 1951 Singapore City Council election was the 1st election to the Singapore City Council. It was held on 1 December 1951 to elect 6 of the 18 seats in the City Council. == Results == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:right" ! colspan="2" rowspan="2" |Party ! rowspan="2" |Votes ! rowspan="2" |% ! rowspan="2" |+/– ! colspan="2" |Seats ! rowspan="2" |+/– |- !Won !Total |- | bgcolor="" | | align="left" |Progressive Party |6,729 |43.2 | 10.8 |2 |9 | 1 |- | bgcolor="" | | align="left" |Labour Party |4,436 |28.5 | 11.3 |3 |6 | 3 |- | bgcolor="" | | align="left" |Independents |4,412 |28.3 |– |1 |3 | 2 |- | colspan="2" align="left" |Invalid/blank votes |343 |– |– |– |– |– |- | colspan="2" align="left" |Total |15,920 |100 |– |6 |18 |– |- | colspan="2" align="left" |Registered voters/turnout |26,831 |59.3 | 4.2 |– |– |– |- | colspan="8" align="left" |Source: Singapore Elections |} === By constituency === {| class="wikitable sortable" !Constituency !Electorate !Party !Candidate !Votes !% |- | rowspan="2" |City | rowspan="2" align="right" |4,277 |Independent |Hassan Ali Jivabhai |align="right" |1,154 | |- | |M. Oli Mohamed Mohamed Kassim |align="right" |887 | |- | rowspan="3" |East | rowspan="3" align="right" |4,797 |'''''' |Chan Kum Chee | align="right" |1,401 | |- | |Lee Yong Min | align="right" |724 | |- |Independent |Mak Pak Shee | align="right" |720 | |- | rowspan="4" |North | rowspan="4" align="right" |4,783 |'''''' |Arumugam Ponnu Rajah | align="right" |1,378 | |- | |Anthony Rebeiro Lazarous | align="right" |1,074 | |- |Independent |Anthony Pecci Netto | align="right" |641 | |- |Independent |Siow Siang Yew |align="right" |136 | |- | rowspan="2" |Rochore | rowspan="2" align="right" |4,648 |'''''' |Philip Rajanayam Williams | align="right" |1,761 | |- | |Seah Peng Chuan | align="right" |1,005 | |- | rowspan="2" |South | rowspan="2" align="right" |5,985 |'''''' |Vellekat Kesavan Nair | align="right" |1,933 | |- | |Manickvasagar Subramaniam | align="right" |1,457 | |- | rowspan="2" |West | rowspan="2" align="right" |2,341 |'''''' |Lee Choon Eng | align="right" |705 | |- | |Cuthbert Francis Joseph Ess | align="right" |904 | |- class="sortbottom" | colspan="6" |Source: Singapore Elections |} ==References== Category:Singapore City Council elections Category:1951 in Singapore Category:1951 elections in Asia Category:December 1951 events
